result.execSummary:
The defendant Bruce Lee Dennis Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fin.Trans.Card-Fraud. Use (>$2500-$5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(5)(a)1a.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Petition for sentence adjust denied-public interst

records.addlTxt:
03:36 PM    Judge McKnight appears by video from Washburn County.  Defendant Bruce Dennis appears by telephone from Winnebago County jail.   Bruce Poquette appears for the State of WI.  
Defendant has filed petitions for sentence adjustment in 11CF203, 12CF42 and 14CF108.  DE states he has not been able to do any programming due to overcrowding- he has been serving his prison time in jail and no programming exists.
Atty Poquette makes statement, objects to sentence adjustment.   
Court statement: Court is required to review certain factors. Court understands frustration of the DE, but the factors the court is expected to review do not reveal anything that calls for sentence adjustment.
Court denies Petition for sentence adjustment in all cases.
Sentence adjustment review on January 17, 2020 at 03:15 pm.
